MainCategory.Description: Communication and Interpersonal Skills: Ability to effectively communicate with clients, internal teams, and management, both verbally and in writing, is crucial for building relationships and resolving issues.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess through interview questions focusing on problem explanation, conflict resolution, and relationship building. Review past experiences and examples provided. Check references for feedback on communication style.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Demonstrates poor communication skills, struggles to articulate ideas, and has difficulty building rapport.
Communicates adequately but lacks finesse. Shows some ability to build relationships but may struggle in conflict situations.
Communicates effectively and builds strong relationships with minimal guidance. Handles conflict professionally.
Exceptional communication skills, a natural relationship builder, and adept at conflict resolution. Clearly able to communicate with internal and external stakeholders.

MainCategory.Description: Client Relationship Management: Focuses on the ability to build, maintain, and grow relationships with clients, understanding their needs, and ensuring satisfaction.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate through interview questions on maintaining long-term relationships and past successes. Check references on client satisfaction and relationship longevity. Assess their understanding of client needs and pain points.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Struggles to build and maintain client relationships. Shows little understanding of client needs.
Adequately manages client relationships but lacks proactivity. Understands basic client needs.
Proactively manages client relationships and understands client needs. Demonstrates a track record of client retention.
Expert in client relationship management. Builds deep, lasting relationships and anticipates client needs. Drives account growth.

MainCategory.Description: Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: This category covers the ability to identify, analyze, and solve problems for clients, using data and industry knowledge to provide effective solutions.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess through behavioral interview questions focusing on problem-solving scenarios. Evaluate ability to analyze data and identify trends. Assess knowledge of the industry and company offerings.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Struggles to identify and solve problems. Lacks analytical skills and industry knowledge.
Adequately solves problems with guidance. Shows some analytical skills and industry knowledge.
Independently solves problems and analyzes data effectively. Demonstrates strong industry knowledge.
Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills. Proactively identifies and solves problems, using data to drive growth.

MainCategory.Description: Organizational and Time Management Skills: The ability to manage multiple accounts, prioritize tasks, and maintain organization under pressure is essential for an account executive.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess through interview questions about managing multiple accounts and staying organized. Evaluate experience with project management software. Check references for feedback on organizational skills.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Poor organizational and time management skills. Struggles to manage multiple accounts.
Adequate organizational and time management skills but may struggle under pressure.
Strong organizational and time management skills. Effectively manages multiple accounts and prioritizes tasks.
Exceptional organizational and time management skills. Highly efficient and effectively manages multiple accounts under pressure.

MainCategory.Description: Sales and Revenue Generation: The ability to identify opportunities for upselling, prospecting for new clients, and contributing to revenue goals is crucial.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate through interview questions about upselling strategies and revenue generation. Assess experience with sales teams and closing deals. Check references for sales performance.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Lacks sales and revenue generation skills. Unable to identify opportunities for upselling or prospecting.
Adequate sales and revenue generation skills but requires guidance. Identifies some opportunities for upselling or prospecting.
Strong sales and revenue generation skills. Proactively identifies opportunities for upselling and prospecting.
Exceptional sales and revenue generation skills. Consistently exceeds revenue goals and drives account growth.

SubCategory.Description: CRM Software Proficiency: Demonstrates familiarity with customer relationship management (CRM) software like Zoho, HubSpot, and Salesforce, and understands the importance of data-driven decision-making.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Directly ask about experience with specific CRM software. Evaluate understanding of data-driven approaches.

ScoringGuided.Comment: No familiarity with CRM software or data-driven decision-making.
Basic familiarity with CRM software but limited understanding of its application.
Proficient with at least one CRM software and understands the importance of data.
Expert in multiple CRM software and demonstrates a strong understanding of data-driven approaches.

SubCategory.Description: Upselling and Cross-selling Skills: The ability to identify opportunities to upsell or cross-sell to existing clients by understanding their pain points and offering solutions.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's step-by-step approach to upselling and their ability to demonstrate a clear return on investment.

ScoringGuided.Comment: No understanding of upselling or cross-selling strategies.
Basic understanding of upselling but lacks a clear action plan.
Clear approach to upselling and can demonstrate a return on investment.
Expert in upselling and cross-selling, with a proven track record of success.

SubCategory.Description: Prioritization and Focus: The ability to prioritize tasks, stay focused on key objectives, and maintain motivation, even on less interesting accounts.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's organizational strategies and their willingness to seek help or new perspectives from other teams.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Struggles to prioritize tasks and maintain focus.
Adequate prioritization skills but may lose focus on less interesting tasks.
Strong prioritization skills and maintains focus on key objectives.
Exceptional prioritization skills and remains highly motivated, even on less interesting accounts.

SubCategory.Description: Conflict Resolution: The ability to handle uncooperative or challenging clients with sensitivity and professionalism.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Use behavioral questions to assess the candidate's interpersonal skills and approach to conflict resolution.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Poor interpersonal skills and struggles to resolve conflicts.
Adequate interpersonal skills but may struggle with aggressive clients.
Strong interpersonal skills and handles conflicts professionally.
Excellent interpersonal skills and adept at conflict resolution, maintaining client satisfaction.

SubCategory.Description: Adaptability and Teamwork: The ability to adapt to unexpected situations, work effectively with other teams, and defer to their expertise when necessary.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's willingness to adapt and their ability to work collaboratively through behavioral questions and reference checks.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Inflexible and struggles to work with others.
Adequately adapts to changes and works with others but may be resistant to new ideas.
Readily adapts to changes and works effectively with other teams.
Highly adaptable and an excellent team player, able to leverage expertise across teams.
